Player.log

What are your PC specs?

Can you describe the problem?

System Manufacturer: HP
             System Model: OMEN by HP Laptop
                     BIOS: F.09 (type: UEFI)
                Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-6700HQ CPU @ 2.60GHz (8 CPUs), ~2.6GHz
                   Memory: 16384MB RAM
      Available OS Memory: 16274MB RAM
                Page File: 21405MB used, 8402MB available
              Windows Dir: C:\WINDOWS
          DirectX Version: DirectX 12

It stalls on 'Serenity'

Well, im having trouble with your log file.

Dropbox says that the file doesn´t exists, try OneDrive or Google Drive.

I can´t say more without a log.

3 minutes ago, Commodoregamer118 said:

Well, im having trouble with your log file.

Dropbox says that the file doesn´t exists, try OneDrive or Google Drive.

I can´t say more without a log.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ltS_j_v7UWeexZ9kM1bbHffyNK1tLi20/view?usp=sharing

Looks like there was a problem in the load, the last module on load was ElectionLabel from VanguardTechnologies.

If im am correct that was the last part before the expansions, but then the log says that the mod QuickExit was executed, and i see no expansion part loadout,

Serenity is Breaking Ground expansion, do you have Making History?

Sounds like the parachutes mod.

Yes I have both DLC.

Then there is a problem, while in expansion loadout first goes Making History, then Breaking Ground.

If the game crash on Breaking Ground the Making History would have been loaded, but there is no expansion module.

Looks like you have missing files, if you are on Steam do a file validation.

7 hours ago, Commodoregamer118 said:

Then there is a problem, while in expansion loadout first goes Making History, then Breaking Ground.

If the game crash on Breaking Ground the Making History would have been loaded, but there is no expansion module.

Looks like you have missing files, if you are on Steam do a file validation.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tzGgCoOwmbTX-R0HrS3Tgf85X_1sNM2O
Still not working.
Ok, i need now the KSP.log to see the whole activity to find what is happening on there.

2 minutes ago, Commodoregamer118 said:

Ok, i need now the KSP.log to see the whole activity to find what is happening on there.

Can you view it now?

3 minutes ago, PyjackMeat said:

Can you view it now?

Just the Player.log

I can´t see the KSP.log

Just now, Commodoregamer118 said:

Just the Player.log

I can´t see the KSP.log

Ah. Well, I decided to rebuild my modlist from scratch so I don't have the right KSP.log now.

55 minutes ago, PyjackMeat said:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1mu2xjGVXoj_XPu32LQafb8LFqPYMiFM4 -ksp.log
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Kf-WbJ2IQjDfcFc81HEykkOCsVXyim0A -player.log

 

On 11/12/2019 at 10:15 PM, Commodoregamer118 said:

Just the Player.log

I can´t see the KSP.log

I have issues with 1.8.1, sometimes crashing at load, sometimes crashing while playing. When crashing while playing, my monitors flickers on and off, and my browser dies (i even had to reboot the computer once, because all the windows were glitching). It seems that 1.8.1 uses a new version of Unity (2019.2.2f1) and Unity is messing with the video driver.

https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/24058

I have to revert back to 1.7.3. This is a very serious issue.

Edited November 22, 2020 by JeanRenaud
